Documentation & publishing system
for the Hybrid Publishing Consortium and beyond

Diagram

The Hybrid Publishing Consortiumâ€™s Dossiers are composed of a selection and arrangement of 500-2000 words working papers/reports, with an introduction explaining the composition. The reports can be commissioned texts as well as pre-existing ones, they are multi-format: lists, essays, notes, slide shows, etc.

In order to be able to publish a report in several Dossiers, the system for editing/organizing/archiving the reports need to be flexible.

The reports will be stored in a GitHub repository, each one in a folder composed of the content in an html file, a folder for images and other documents, and a css file (when neccessary).

Single source, yet medium specific

To tune specific parts of the reports, add a specific class name (convention needed for that) that will then be displayed or not on specific formats.

HTML style guide

If we want ePub-ready files, we should write in a compatible way (ePub is XHTML). A solution for that is Polyglot Markup. We can also run a validator (with HTML5 Validator, that can be run with Travis CI), which validates the code that is pushed on GitHub.

And ask Gerrit if their are automatic solutions to convert HTML5 to XHTML.
